  <script type="text/javascript">
    (function() {
        var contextPath = '/jira';
        var eventBuffer = [];

        function printDeprecatedMsg() {
            if (console && console.warn) {
                console.warn('DEPRECATED JS - contextPath global variable has been deprecated since 7.4.0. Use `wrm/context-path` module instead.');
            }
        }

        function sendEvent(analytics, postfix) {
            analytics.send({
                name: 'js.globals.contextPath.' + postfix
            });
        }

        function sendDeprecatedEvent(postfix) {
            try {
                var analytics = require('jira/analytics');
                if (eventBuffer.length) {
                    eventBuffer.forEach(function(value) {
                        sendEvent(analytics, value);
                    });
                    eventBuffer = [];
                }

                if (postfix) {
                    sendEvent(analytics, postfix);
                }
            } catch(ex) {
                eventBuffer.push(postfix);
                setTimeout(sendDeprecatedEvent, 1000);
            }
        }

        Object.defineProperty(window, 'contextPath', {
            get: function() {
                printDeprecatedMsg();
                sendDeprecatedEvent('get');
                return contextPath;
            },
            set: function(value) {
                printDeprecatedMsg();
                sendDeprecatedEvent('set');
                contextPath = value;
            }
        });
    })();

</script>

              <div id="descriptionmodule" class="module toggle-wrap">
               <div id="descriptionmodule_heading" class="mod-header">
                <ul class="ops"></ul>
                <h2 class="toggle-title">Description</h2>
               </div>
               <div class="mod-content">
                <div id="description-val" class="field-ignore-highlight"> 
                 <div class="user-content-block"> 
                  <p>Create a version of Cooccurrence Analysis (RowSimilarityJob with LLR) that runs on Spark. This should be compatible with Mahout Spark DRM DSL so a DRM can be used as input. </p> 
                  <p>Ideally this would extend to cover <a href="https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MAHOUT-1422" title="Make a version of RSJ that uses two inputs" class="issue-link" data-issue-key="MAHOUT-1422"><del>MAHOUT-1422</del></a>. This cross-cooccurrence has several applications including cross-action recommendations. </p> 
                 </div> 
                </div> 
               </div>
              </div>
              <div id="dnd-metadata" class="module toggle-wrap">
               <div id="dnd-metadata_heading" class="mod-header">
                <ul class="ops"></ul>

               </div>
               <div class="mod-content">
                <div id="dnd-metadata-webpanel" data-can-attach="false" data-project-type="software" data-upload-limit="62914560" data-thumbnails-allowed="false"></div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div id="attachmentmodule" class="module toggle-wrap">
               <div id="attachmentmodule_heading" class="mod-header">
                <ul class="ops">
                 <li class="drop">
                  <div class="aui-dd-parent">
                   <a href="#" class="icon drop-menu js-default-dropdown" title="Options"><span>Options</span></a>
                   <div class="aui-dropdown-content aui-list">
                    <ul id="attachment-sorting-options" class="aui-list-section aui-first">

                     <li class="aui-list-item"><a id="attachment-sort-key-date" href="/jira/browse/MAHOUT-1464?attachmentSortBy=dateTime#attachmentmodule" class="aui-list-checked aui-list-item-link" title="Sort By Date"><span>Sort By Date</span></a></li>

the physical operator for non-skinny A. There are two distinct algorithms to deal with it. Skinny one (n &lt;= 5000 or something) uses upper-triangular vector-backed accumulator to combine stuff right in map. Of course if accumulator does not realistically fit in memory then another algorithm has to be plugged in for A-squared. See AtA.scala, def at_a_nongraph(). It currently throws UnsupportedOperation (but everything i have done so far only uses slim A\'A)\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e2. when using partial functions with mapBlock, you actually do not have to use (\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n{...}\\n\u003cp\u003e) but just { }:\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\u003cdiv class=\\\"code panel\\\" style=\\\"border-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeContent panelContent\\\"\u003e\\n\u003cpre class=\\\"code-java\\\"\u003e      drmBt = drmBt.mapBlock() {\\n        \u003cspan class=\\\"code-keyword\\\"\u003ecase\u003c\\/span\u003e (keys, block) =&gt;\\n\u003cspan class=\\\"code-comment\\\"\u003e\\/\\/...\\n\u003c\\/span\u003e          keys -&gt; There are two distinct algorithms to deal with it. Skinny one (n &lt;= 5000 or something) uses upper-triangular vector-backed accumulator to combine stuff right in map. Of course if accumulator does not realistically fit in memory then another algorithm has to be plugged in for A-squared. See AtA.scala, def at_a_nongraph(). It currently throws UnsupportedOperation (but everything i have done so far only uses slim A\'A) \\n\\n 2. when using partial functions with mapBlock, you actually do not have to use ( \\n{...}\\n ) but just { }: \\n  \\n       drmBt = drmBt.mapBlock() {\\n         case  (keys, block) =&gt;\\n \\/\\/...\\n           keys -&gt; block\\n      }\\n \\n               \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eI have non-slim A\'A. Of course slim operator implementation is upper triangular that cuts outer product computation cost two times in comparison... Significantly wide A\'A on the other hand cannot really apply the same cut, since it needs to form rows in distributed way.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eNot surprisingly, slim test takes 17 seconds  and the \\\"fat\\\" one takes 21 seconds on my fairly ancient computer for squaring 400x550 matrix (single thread). Actually, i expected a little more significant gap.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e I wonder if there\'s a more interesting way to do this other than forming outer product vertical blocks.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eMaybe I need to use square blocks. In this case i can reuse roughly half of them &#8211; but then there will be significantly more objects with this (albeit smaller in size). and then i will have to have an extra shuffle operation to form the lower triangular part of the matrix still. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eAnyway. i think i will commit what i have.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13941517_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13941517_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'20\\/Mar\\/14 08:43\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-03-20T08:43:55+0000\'\u003e20\\/Mar\\/14 08:43\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    I have non-slim A\'A. Of course slim operator implementation is upper triangular that cuts outer product computation cost two times in comparison... Significantly wide A\'A on the other hand cannot really apply the same cut, since it needs to form rows in distributed way. \\n\\n Not surprisingly, slim test takes 17 seconds  and the \\\"fat\\\" one takes 21 seconds on my fairly ancient computer for squaring 400x550 matrix (single thread). Actually, i expected a little more significant gap. \\n\\n  I wonder if there\'s a more interesting way to do this other than forming outer product vertical blocks. \\n\\n Maybe I need to use square blocks. In this case i can reuse roughly half of them &#8211; but then there will be significantly more objects with this (albeit smaller in size). and then i will have to have an extra shuffle operation to form the lower triangular part of the matrix still.  \\n\\n Anyway. i think i will commit what i have.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eOn Thu, Mar 20, 2014 at 1:42 AM, Sebastian Schelter (JIRA)\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eFor that very reason, i almost always use SRM and almost never SM.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eWhat i really would probably love is a sparse row and column block (hash\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nhanging from hash), this seems like recurring issue in blocking\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\ncalculations such as ALS. SRM does always that, except it uses full size\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nvector to hang sprase vectors off.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13941520_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13941520_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'20\\/Mar\\/14 08:47\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-03-20T08:47:45+0000\'\u003e20\\/Mar\\/14 08:47\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    On Thu, Mar 20, 2014 at 1:42 AM, Sebastian Schelter (JIRA) \\n\\n For that very reason, i almost always use SRM and almost never SM. \\n\\n What i really would probably love is a sparse row and column block (hash \\nhanging from hash), this seems like recurring issue in blocking \\ncalculations such as ALS. Would that make sense?              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-13941531\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-expanded\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHide\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-links\\\"\u003e\\n                \u003ca href=\\\"\\/jira\\/browse\\/MAHOUT-1464?focusedCommentId=13941531&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13941531\\\"\\n                   title=\\\"Right click and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-link\\\"\u003ePermalink\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n                                            \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details\\\"\u003e        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13941531_verbose\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13941531_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'20\\/Mar\\/14 09:06\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-03-20T09:06:39+0000\'\u003e20\\/Mar\\/14 09:06\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eNo, i think blockify is fine. it probably can run a bit faster than it does, but oh well. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eAnd mapblock doesn\'t trigger it (or, rather, it is evaluated lazily; and if previous operator already produced blocks, then blockify is not used). what i was saying is along the lines of A\'A computation. There\'s a structure that is used to fuse operators, which is sort of \\\"eitherOr\\\" of either DrmRdd or BlockifiedDrmRdd type. I can to conclusion that there are operators that are absolute pain to implement on blocks, and there are that would be pain to implement on row vector bags. But blocks can be presented as row bags via viewing, so conversion to blocks happens only if subsequent operator requires it. What\'s more, usually block operator outputs blocks as well and vice versa, so realistically blockify happens not so often at all.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eAnother caveat is that one has to be careful with map blocks with side effects on RDD of origin. Even though Spark says all RDDs are immutable, side effects will stay visible to parent RDDs if they are cached as MEMORY_ONLY or MEMORY_AND_DISK (i.e. without mandatory clone-via-serialization in block manager) and then subsequently used as a source again.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13941531_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13941531_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'20\\/Mar\\/14 09:06\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-03-20T09:06:39+0000\'\u003e20\\/Mar\\/14 09:06\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    No, i think blockify is fine. it probably can run a bit faster than it does, but oh well.  \\n\\n And mapblock doesn\'t trigger it (or, rather, it is evaluated lazily; and if previous operator already produced blocks, then blockify is not used). what i was saying is along the lines of A\'A computation. There\'s a structure that is used to fuse operators, which is sort of \\\"eitherOr\\\" of either DrmRdd or BlockifiedDrmRdd type. I can to conclusion that there are operators that are absolute pain to implement on blocks, and there are that would be pain to implement on row vector bags. But blocks can be presented as row bags via viewing, so conversion to blocks happens only if subsequent operator requires it. What\'s more, usually block operator outputs blocks as well and vice versa, so realistically blockify happens not so often at all. \\n\\n Another caveat is that one has to be careful with map blocks with side effects on RDD of origin. Even though Spark says all RDDs are immutable, side effects will stay visible to parent RDDs if they are cached as MEMORY_ONLY or MEMORY_AND_DISK (i.e. without mandatory clone-via-serialization in block manager) and then subsequently used as a source again.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-13941541\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-expanded\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHide\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-links\\\"\u003e\\n                \u003ca and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13941541_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'20\\/Mar\\/14 09:21\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-03-20T09:21:35+0000\'\u003e20\\/Mar\\/14 09:21\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eOh, you mean in case of sparse row vectors.\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n You are probably right. indeed, there\'s currently a SparseMatrix there in this case. I think it should be SparseRowMatrix of course. most of the cases should benefit from it. Problem is, like i said, mapblock doesn\'t really form it; nor any other physical operator has any knowledge what formed it. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eIt is possible to optimize the entire operator fusion chain based on subsequent operator preferred type, that\'s actually a very neat idea for in-core speed optimization; but i have no capacity to pursue this technique at the moment. It needs some digestion anyway (at least on my end). It requires experiments with in-core operations. At the first glance, most non-multiplicative operators would be ok with row-wise matrix, as well as deblockifying views.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13941541_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13941541_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'20\\/Mar\\/14 09:21\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-03-20T09:21:35+0000\'\u003e20\\/Mar\\/14 09:21\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Oh, you mean in case of sparse row vectors. \\n You are probably right. indeed, there\'s currently a SparseMatrix there in this case. I think it should be SparseRowMatrix of course. most of the cases should benefit from it. Problem is, like i said, mapblock doesn\'t really form it; nor any other physical operator has any knowledge what formed it.  \\n\\n It is possible to optimize the entire operator fusion chain based on subsequent operator preferred type, that\'s actually a very neat idea for in-core speed optimization; but i have no capacity to pursue this technique at the moment. It needs some digestion anyway (at least on my end). It requires experiments with in-core operations. At the first glance, most non-multiplicative operators would be ok with row-wise matrix, as well as deblockifying views.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-13941545\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n   \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13941545_verbose\\\" Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13941545_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'20\\/Mar\\/14 09:25\'\u003e\u003ctime \u003cspan class=\\\"redText subText\\\" title=\\\"Dmitriy Lyubimov - 24\\/Mar\\/14 05:10\\\"\u003eedited\u003c\\/span\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eAdding 16 cores to my closet\'s cluster next week. Is there a \'large\' dataset you have in mind? I have one with 4000 rows, 75,000 columns and 700,000 values but that seems smallish. Can\'t say when I\'ll get to it but it\'s on my list. If someone can jump in quicker--have at it.\u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e@Sebastian, actually matrix squaring is incredibly expensive &#8211; size ^1.5 for the flops alone. Did your original version also used matrix squaring? How did it fare?\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eAlso, since the flops grow power-law w.r.t input size (it is a problem for ssvd, too) we may need to contemplate a technique that creates finer splits for such computations based on input size. It very well may be the case that original hdfs splits may turn out to be too large for adequate load redistribution.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eTechnically, it is extremely simple &#8211; we\'d just have to insert a physical operator tweaking RDD splits via \\\"shuffless\\\" coalesce() which also costs nothing in Spark. However, i am not sure what would be sensible API for this &#8211; automatic, semi-automatic cost-based...  \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eI guess one brainless thing to do is to parameterize optimizer context with desired parallelism (~cluster task capacity) and have optimizer to insert physical opertors that very # of partitions and do automatic shuffless coalesce if the number is too low\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eany thoughts?\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n                                            \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13944755_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13944755_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'24\\/Mar\\/14 05:08\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-03-24T05:08:33+0000\'\u003e24\\/Mar\\/14 05:08\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e   - \u003cspan class=\\\"redText subText\\\" title=\\\"Dmitriy Lyubimov - 24\\/Mar\\/14 05:10\\\"\u003eedited\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Adding 16 cores to my closet\'s cluster next week. Is there a \'large\' dataset you have in mind? I have one with 4000 rows, 75,000 columns and 700,000 values but that seems smallish. Can\'t say when I\'ll get to it but it\'s on my list. If someone can jump in quicker--have at it.  \\n\\n @Sebastian, actually matrix squaring is incredibly expensive &#8211; size ^1.5 for the flops alone. Did your original version also used matrix squaring? How did it fare? \\n\\n Also, since the flops grow power-law w.r.t input size (it is a problem for ssvd, too) we may need to contemplate a technique that creates finer splits for such computations based on input size. It very well may be the case that original hdfs splits may turn out to be too large for adequate load redistribution. \\n\\n Technically, it is extremely simple &#8211; we\'d just have to insert a physical operator tweaking RDD splits via \\\"shuffless\\\" coalesce() which also costs nothing in Spark. However, i am not sure what would be sensible API for this &#8211; automatic, semi-automatic cost-based...   \\n\\n I guess one brainless thing to do is to parameterize optimizer context with desired parallelism (~cluster task capacity) and have optimizer to insert physical opertors that very # of partitions and do automatic shuffless coalesce if the number is too low \\n\\n any thoughts? src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13968587_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'14\\/Apr\\/14 17:57\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-14T17:57:24+0000\'\u003e14\\/Apr\\/14 17:57\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eRunning using Spark Client (inside the cluster) is a new thing in 0.9. Assuming it is stable, it is not supported at this point and going this way will have multiple hurdles. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003efor one, mahout spark context requires MAHOUT_HOME to set all mahout binaries properly. The assumption is one needs Mahout\'s binaries only on driver\'s side, but if driver runs inside remote cluster, this will fail. So our batches should really be started in one of the ways i described in earlier email. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eSecond, i don\'t think driver can load classes reliably because it includes Mahout dependencies such as mahout-math. That\'s another reason why using Client seems problematic to me &#8211; it assumes one has his \u003cem\u003eentire\u003c\\/em\u003e application within that jar. So not true.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThat said, your attempt doesn\'t exhibit any direct ClassNotFounds and looks more like akka communication issues i.e. spark setup issues. One thing about Spark is that requires direct port connectivity not only between cluster nodes but also back to client. In particular it means your client must not firewall incoming calls and must not be behind NAT. (even port forwarding doesn\'t really solve networking issues here). So my first bet would be on akka connectivity issues between cluster and back to client.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13968587_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13968587_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'14\\/Apr\\/14 17:57\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-14T17:57:24+0000\'\u003e14\\/Apr\\/14 17:57\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Running using Spark Client (inside the cluster) is a new thing in 0.9. Assuming it is stable, it is not supported at this point and going this way will have multiple hurdles.  \\n\\n for one, mahout spark context requires MAHOUT_HOME to set all mahout binaries properly. The assumption is one needs Mahout\'s binaries only on driver\'s side, but if driver runs inside remote cluster, this will fail. So our batches should really be started in one of the ways i described in earlier email.  \\n\\n Second, i don\'t think driver can load classes reliably because it includes Mahout dependencies such as mahout-math. That\'s another reason why using Client seems problematic to me &#8211; it assumes one has his  entire  application within that jar. So not true. \\n\\n That said, your attempt doesn\'t exhibit any direct ClassNotFounds and looks more like akka communication issues i.e. spark setup issues. One thing about Spark is that requires direct port connectivity not only between cluster nodes but also back to client. In particular it means your client must not firewall incoming calls and must not be behind NAT. (even port forwarding doesn\'t really solve networking issues here). So my first bet would be on akka connectivity issues between cluster and back to client. \\n\\n             \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-13968589\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-expanded\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHide\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-links\\\"\u003e\\n                \u003ca href=\\\"\\/jira\\/browse\\/MAHOUT-1464?focusedCommentId=13968589&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13968589\\\"\\n                   title=\\\"Right click and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-link\\\"\u003ePermalink\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n                                            \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details\\\"\u003e        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"pferrel\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13968589_verbose\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=pferrel\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"pferrel\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Pat Ferrel\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - Either way, it will not work with Sebastian\'s app. Instead, I\'d suggest you to run Sebastian script directly from IDEA as a first step, after hacking master url in this \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13968603_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'14\\/Apr\\/14 18:09\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-14T18:09:53+0000\'\u003e14\\/Apr\\/14 18:09\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                     Pat Ferrel  if you look inside the Sebastian\'s patch, you will find it is hardcoded to use \\\"local\\\" Spark master. The master you specify to Client only tells which cluster to ship code to, not which master for the application to use. Which is why i think this Client thing is a little bit raw idea. Either way, it will not work with Sebastian\'s app. Instead, I\'d suggest you to run Sebastian script directly from IDEA as a first step, after hacking master url in this line \\n  \\n implicit val sc = mahoutSparkContext(masterUrl =  \\\"local\\\" , appName =  \\\"MahoutLocalContext\\\" ,\\n+      customJars = Traversable.empty[ String ])\\n \\n  \\n or making the script to accept it from environment or app params.  \\n\\n (the convention in Spark example programs is that they accept master url as the first parameter).              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eIDEA is driver. but output is written by spark workers. Which i assume it was not.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThis is strange. I can, was able to and will able to. why wouldn\'t it able\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nto? unless there are network or security issues. There\'s nothing\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nfundamentally different between reading\\/writing hdfs from a worker process\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nor any other process.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eNo. Spark client is about shipping driver and have it running somewhere\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nelse. it is as if somebody was running mahout cli command on one of the\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nworker nodes. this is it. it knows nothing about hdfs &#8211; and even what the\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\ndriver program is going to do. One might use the Client code to print out\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n\\\"Hello, World\\\" and exit on some of the worker nodes, the Client wouldn\'t\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nknow or care. Not the same \\nenvironment, and in most cases, not the same machine. Just like it happens \\nfor MR reducers. Unless it is \\\"local\\\" master url. Which i assume it was not. \\n\\n\\n This is strange. I can, was able to and will able to. why wouldn\'t it able \\nto? unless there are network or security issues. There\'s nothing \\nfundamentally different between reading\\/writing hdfs from a worker process \\nor any other process. \\n\\n\\n\\n No. Spark client is about shipping driver and have it running somewhere \\nelse. it is as if somebody was running mahout cli command on one of the \\nworker nodes. this is it. it knows nothing about hdfs &#8211; and even what the \\ndriver program is going to do. One might use the Client code to print out \\n\\\"Hello, World\\\" and exit on some of the worker nodes, the Client wouldn\'t \\nknow or care. Using a worker to run driver programs, that\'s all it does. \\n\\n             \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-13968864\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-expanded\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHide\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-links\\\"\u003e\\n                \u003ca href=\\\"\\/jira\\/browse\\/MAHOUT-1464?focusedCommentId=13968864&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13968864\\\"\\n                   title=\\\"Right click and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-link\\\"\u003ePermalink\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n                                            \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details\\\"\u003e        \\n    \\n    \\n                                            \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"pferrel\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13968864_verbose\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=pferrel\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"pferrel\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Pat Ferrel\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13968864_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'14\\/Apr\\/14 21:27\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-14T21:27:25+0000\'\u003e14\\/Apr\\/14 21:27\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e   - \u003cspan class=\\\"redText subText\\\" title=\\\"Pat Ferrel - 14\\/Apr\\/14 21:28\\\"\u003eedited\u003c\\/span\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eI think IDEA forces some things to run local so it can keep track of threads or something. Seems to work correctly with Spark but not HDFS. There are ways to remote debug with it so it separates processes but I don\'t need you to help me with IDEA.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eSeems easier to answer: How do I run this from the CLI? Let\'s get IDEA out of the picture. I bet it will just work.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eWe need a way to run these from the CLI via cron or scripts anyway, right?\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eUsing spark-class I get no errors but no output either. \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13969961_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'15\\/Apr\\/14 19:30\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-15T19:30:16+0000\'\u003e15\\/Apr\\/14 19:30\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003ewhere -cp is what `mahout classpath` returns.\u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eActually, scratch that. That generally is still a bad recipe. \\\"mahout classpath\\\" would return installed HADOOP_HOME  dependencies (normally one doesn\'t want that because spark managed-libs already exposes whatever version of hadoop it was compiled with), and it neglects to add Spark classpath. So i don\'t this \'mahout classpath\' is plenty useful here. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eBTW that\'s another thing here &#8211; you need to compile Spark with correct version of hadoop hdfs you intend to use (at least that\'s what i do). By default i think it does a terrible thing.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThe main suggestion stands &#8211; collect \'cp\' correctly, which idea already does via maven, but the major hurdle is to do it manually &#8211; and user-friendly methods for those are not yet present methinks.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13969961_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13969961_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'15\\/Apr\\/14 19:30\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-15T19:30:16+0000\'\u003e15\\/Apr\\/14 19:30\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                     where -cp is what `mahout classpath` returns.  \\n\\n Actually, scratch that. That generally is still a bad recipe. \\\"mahout classpath\\\" would return installed HADOOP_HOME  dependencies (normally one doesn\'t want that because spark managed-libs already exposes whatever version of hadoop it was compiled with), and it neglects to add Spark classpath. So i don\'t this \'mahout classpath\' is plenty useful here.  \\n\\n BTW that\'s another thing here &#8211; you need to compile Spark with correct version of hadoop hdfs you intend to use (at least that\'s what i do). By default i think it does a terrible thing. \\n\\n The main suggestion stands &#8211; collect \'cp\' correctly, which idea already does via maven, but the major hurdle is to do it manually &#8211; and user-friendly methods for those are not yet present methinks.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eWell here\'s something I noticed that may be a clue. First there were some scala 2.10 jars that were built for hadoop 1.0.4 sitting in an assembly\\/target dir. So even though the managed_lib dir had the correct 1.2.1 version of hadoop I rebuilt and go rid of any 1.0.4 jars I could find.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThen if I am running hadoop and mahout locally I can launch the Spark shell, where it creates a default context called sc. I can then perform the following:\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eCreated spark context..\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nSpark context available as sc.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003escala&gt;  val textFile = sc.textFile(\\\"xrsj\\/ratings_data.txt\\\")\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n14\\/04\\/16 18:19:52 INFO storage.MemoryStore: ensureFreeSpace(61374) called with curMem=0, maxMem=318111744\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n14\\/04\\/16 18:19:52 INFO storage.MemoryStore: Block broadcast_0 stored as values to memory (estimated size 59.9 KB, free 303.3 MB)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\ntextFile: org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;String&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e = MappedRDD\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;1&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e at textFile at &lt;console&gt;:12\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003escala&gt; textFile.count()\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n14\\/04\\/16 18:19:59 WARN util.NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n...\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n14\\/04\\/16 18:20:00 INFO spark.SparkContext: Job finished: count at &lt;console&gt;:15, took 0.995702 s\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nres0: Long = 664824\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eIf I exit the spark shell, start a local pseudo cluster then start the shell the same code works, only reading from the hdfs pseudo-cluster. The same exact code works for the cluster too since the file is at the same location relative to where I start the shell.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eI can also address the file in absolute terms with the line below. Notice I need to use the port # and leaving if off leads to the failure to connect message in a previous comment. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003escala&gt;  val textFile = sc.textFile(\\\"hdfs:\\/\\/occam4:54310\\/user\\/pat\\/xrsj\\/ratings_data.txt\\\")\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nscala&gt; textFile.count()\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eI tried using the port # in the cooccurrence test case but get the same failure to connect message.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eSince the Spark Scala shell is creating the context by detecting the machine\'s HDFS setup, could this be the problem in the IDEA running cooccurrence example? The context in the example is setup after the input is read from HDFS is that correct? I know it is not supposed to care about HDFS, only the Spark master but obviously when a context is created by the Spark Shell and is using the context to get the text file it works.  Should we be doing that in the example? I\'ll try playing with how the text file is read and where the context is created. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003ePerhaps naively I would have thought that the URI I used for read and write would bypass any default settings in the context but this doesn\'t seem to be true does it? I suspect something in the context or lack of it is causing Spark to be confused about where to read and write from, no matter how explicit the URI. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"pferrel\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13972210_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=pferrel\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"pferrel\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Pat Ferrel\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13972210_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'17\\/Apr\\/14 01:45\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-17T01:45:48+0000\'\u003e17\\/Apr\\/14 01:45\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Well here\'s something I noticed that may be a clue. First there were some scala 2.10 jars that were built for hadoop 1.0.4 sitting in an assembly\\/target dir. So even though the managed_lib dir had the correct 1.2.1 version of hadoop I rebuilt and go rid of any 1.0.4 jars I could find. \\n\\n Then if I am running hadoop and mahout locally I can launch the Spark shell, where it creates a default context called sc. I can then perform the following: \\n\\n Created spark context.. \\nSpark context available as sc. \\n\\n scala&gt;  val textFile = sc.textFile(\\\"xrsj\\/ratings_data.txt\\\") \\n14\\/04\\/16 18:19:52 INFO storage.MemoryStore: ensureFreeSpace(61374) called with curMem=0, maxMem=318111744 \\n14\\/04\\/16 18:19:52 INFO storage.MemoryStore: Block broadcast_0 stored as values to memory (estimated size 59.9 KB, free 303.3 MB) \\ntextFile: org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD &#91;String&#93;  = MappedRDD &#91;1&#93;  at textFile at &lt;console&gt;:12 \\n\\n scala&gt; textFile.count() \\n14\\/04\\/16 18:19:59 WARN util.NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable \\n... \\n14\\/04\\/16 18:20:00 INFO spark.SparkContext: Job finished: count at &lt;console&gt;:15, took 0.995702 s \\nres0: Long = 664824 \\n\\n If I exit the spark shell, start a local pseudo cluster then start the shell the same code works, only reading from the hdfs pseudo-cluster. The same exact code works for the cluster too since the file is at the same location relative to where I start the shell. \\n\\n I can also address the file in absolute terms with the line below. Notice I need to use the port # and leaving if off leads to the failure to connect message in a previous comment.  \\n\\n scala&gt;  val textFile = sc.textFile(\\\"hdfs:\\/\\/occam4:54310\\/user\\/pat\\/xrsj\\/ratings_data.txt\\\") \\nscala&gt; textFile.count() \\n\\n I tried using the port # in the cooccurrence test case but get the same failure to connect message. \\n\\n Since the Spark Scala shell is creating the context by detecting the machine\'s HDFS setup, could this be the problem in the IDEA running cooccurrence example? The context in the example is setup after the input is read from HDFS is that correct? I know it is not supposed to care about HDFS, only the Spark master but obviously when a context is created by the Spark Shell and is using the context to get the text file it works.  Should we be doing that in the example? I\'ll try playing with how the text file is read and where the context is created.  \\n\\n Perhaps naively I would have thought that the URI I used for read and write would bypass any default settings in the context but this doesn\'t seem to be true does it? I suspect something in the context or lack of it is causing Spark to be confused about where to read and write from, no matter how explicit the URI.  \\n             \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n The cooccurrence code does not seem to use the context that is created though the computation does execute on the cluster and seems to complete properly, I wonder if the context is needed to do the read\\/write as it is in the above spark-shell example. So the following val is not use afaikt.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e    implicit val sc = mahoutSparkContext(masterUrl = \\\"spark:\\/\\/occam4:7077\\\", appName = \\\"MahoutClusterContext\\\",\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n      customJars = Traversable.empty\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;String&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e)\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eI can\'t even get this job to complete using the local file system, some strange paths are created for \\\"_temporary\\\" depending on who knows what. one even looked like some version of Linux I don\'t own: Exception in thread \\\"main\\\" org.apache.spark.SparkException: Job aborted: Task 8.0:0 failed 4 times (most recent failure: \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eException failure: java.io.IOException: The temporary job-output directory \u003ca href=\\\"file:\\/private\\/tmp\\/tmp\\/co-occurrence-on-epinions\\/indicators-item-item\\/_temporary\\\" class=\\\"external-link\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow\\\"\u003efile:\\/private\\/tmp\\/tmp\\/co-occurrence-on-epinions\\/indicators-item-item\\/_temporary\u003c\\/a\u003e doesn\'t exist!)\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e\\/private\\/tmp ??? what is that Centos? \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003ethe idea most likely willl have screwed hadoop dependency because by default it inherits it from thath of Mahout\'s default dependency. I used to run this stuff (or rather our internal variant of this stuff) from my own project which has a very strict control over dependendencies (esp. hadoop dependencies).  I also inserted a CDH4 profile to spark module which overrides Mahout\'s default hadoop dependency, and that should help &#8211; but it is still a pain, i gave up on running it from idea with Mahout maven dependencies. Something is screwed there in the end.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003ei don\'t experiment with RSJ yet &#8211; i guess i will leave it to Sebastian at this point .\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003ewhat i do is running the following script on my \\\"shell\\\" branch in github via mahout shell\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cdiv class=\\\"code panel\\\" style=\\\"border-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeHeader panelHeader\\\" style=\\\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e\\\"simple.mscala\\\"\u003c\\/b\u003e\u003c\\/div\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeContent panelContent\\\"\u003e\\n\u003cpre class=\\\"code-java\\\"\u003e \\nval a = dense((1,2,3),(3,4,5))\\nval drmA = drmParallelize(a,numPartitions = 2)\\nval drmAtA = drmA.t %*% drmA\\n\\nval r = drmAtA.mapBlock() {\\n  \u003cspan class=\\\"code-keyword\\\"\u003ecase\u003c\\/span\u003e (keys, block) =&gt;\\n    block += 1.0\\n    keys -&gt; block\\n}.checkpoint(\u003cspan class=\\\"code-comment\\\"\u003e\\/*StorageLevel.NONE*\\/\u003c\\/span\u003e)\\n\\nr.collect\\n\\n\u003cspan class=\\\"code-comment\\\"\u003e\\/\\/ local write\\n\u003c\\/span\u003er.writeDRM(\u003cspan class=\\\"code-quote\\\"\u003e\\\"file:\u003cspan class=\\\"code-comment\\\"\u003e\\/\\/\\/home\\/dmitriy\\/A\\\"\u003c\\/span\u003e)\\n\u003c\\/span\u003e\\n\u003cspan class=\\\"code-comment\\\"\u003e\\/\\/ hdfs write\\n\u003c\\/span\u003er.writeDRM(\u003cspan class=\\\"code-quote\\\"\u003e\\\"hdfs:\u003cspan class=\\\"code-comment\\\"\u003e\\/\\/localhost:11010\\/A\\\"\u003c\\/span\u003e)\u003c\\/span\u003e\\n\u003c\\/pre\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\\n\\n\u003cp\u003ewhich actually runs totally fine in local mode, and \u003cem\u003esometimes\u003c\\/em\u003e  also runs ok in \\\"standalone\\\"\\/hdfs mode but sometimes there are strange after-effects of hangs and bailing out with OOM when run on remote cluster with \\\"standalone\\\". \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eI am pretty sure it is either dependency issues again in Mahout maven build, or something that has happened to Spark 0.9.x release.  Spark 0.6.x &#8211; 0.8.x releases and earlier had absolutely no trouble working with hdfs sequence files.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13973288_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13973288_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'17\\/Apr\\/14 19:06\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-17T19:06:29+0000\'\u003e17\\/Apr\\/14 19:06\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    the idea most likely willl have screwed hadoop dependency because by default it inherits it from thath of Mahout\'s default dependency. I used to run this stuff (or rather our internal variant of this stuff) from my own project which has a very strict control over dependendencies (esp. hadoop dependencies).  I also inserted a CDH4 profile to spark module which overrides Mahout\'s default hadoop dependency, and that should help &#8211; but it is still a pain, i gave up on running it from idea with Mahout maven dependencies. Something is screwed there in the end. \\n\\n i don\'t experiment with RSJ yet &#8211; i guess i will leave it to Sebastian at this point . \\n\\n what i do is running the following script on my \\\"shell\\\" branch in github via mahout shell \\n\\n   \\\"simple.mscala\\\"   \\n  \\nval a = dense((1,2,3),(3,4,5))\\nval drmA = drmParallelize(a,numPartitions = 2)\\nval drmAtA = drmA.t %*% drmA\\n\\nval r = drmAtA.mapBlock() {\\n   case  (keys, block) =&gt;\\n    block += 1.0\\n    keys -&gt; block\\n}.checkpoint( \\/*StorageLevel.NONE*\\/ )\\n\\nr.collect\\n\\n \\/\\/ local write\\n r.writeDRM( \\\"file: \\/\\/\\/home\\/dmitriy\\/A\\\" )\\n \\n \\/\\/ hdfs write\\n r.writeDRM( \\\"hdfs: \\/\\/localhost:11010\\/A\\\" ) \\n \\n  \\n\\n\\n which actually runs totally fine in local mode, and  sometimes   also runs ok in \\\"standalone\\\"\\/hdfs mode but sometimes there are strange after-effects of hangs and bailing out with OOM when run on remote cluster with \\\"standalone\\\".  \\n\\n I am pretty sure it is either dependency issues again in Mahout maven build, or something that has happened to Spark 0.9.x release.  Spark 0.6.x &#8211; 0.8.x releases and earlier had absolutely no trouble working with hdfs sequence files.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n I could use a little advice here. The epinions and movielens tests in the examples folder. Should they be put into the build? \\n    &gt; \\n    &gt; Pros: good example data. \\n    &gt; Cons: the reading and writing are not parallel and so only work locally. It is easy to change the Spark context to use a cluster but the data still has to be local. These tests would be easier to maintain if they were attached to the ItemSimilarityDriver, which will handle cluster storage and execution and will be maintained better. \\n    &gt; \\n    &gt; I\'d rather move them out into an ItemSimilarityDriver examples folder and will do this if no one objects. They will not be build tests, obviously, since they take too long. \\n    &gt; \\n    &gt; &#8212; \\n    &gt; Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub: \\n    &gt;  https:\\/\\/github.com\\/apache\\/mahout\\/pull\\/8#issuecomment-45234064  \\n    &gt;              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n title=\'10\\/Jun\\/14 22:42\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-10T22:42:09+0000\'\u003e10\\/Jun\\/14 22:42\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e   - \u003cspan class=\\\"redText subText\\\" title=\\\"Pat Ferrel - 10\\/Jun\\/14 23:09\\\"\u003eedited\u003c\\/span\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eI think the same thing is happening with number of item interactions:\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e    \\/\\/ Broadcast vector containing the number of interactions with each thing\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    val bcastNumInteractions = drmBroadcast(drmI.colSums)\\/\\/ sums?\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThis broadcasts a vector of sums. We need a getNumNonZeroElements() for column vectors,  actually a way to get a Vector of nonZero counts per column? We could get them from rows of the transposed matrix before doing the multiply of At %\u003cb\u003e% A or B.t %\u003c\\/b\u003e% A in which case we\\u2019d get non-zero counts from the rows. Either way I don\\u2019t see a way to get a vector of these values without doing a mapBlock on the transposed matrix. Am I missing something?\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eCurrently the IndexedDataset is a very thin wrapper but I could add two vectors, which contain number of non-zero elements for rows and columns. In this case I would have it extend CheckpointedDrm perhaps. Since CheckpointedDrm extends DrmLike it could be used in the DSL algebra directly, in which case it would be simple to do the right thing with these vectors as well as the two id dictionaries for transpose and multiply but it\\u2019s a slippery slope.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eBefore I go off in the wrong direction is there an existing way to get a vector of non-zero counts for rows or columns?\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n                                            \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"pferrel\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_14027159_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=pferrel\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"pferrel\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Pat Ferrel\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14027159_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'10\\/Jun\\/14 22:42\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-10T22:42:09+0000\'\u003e10\\/Jun\\/14 22:42\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e   - \u003cspan class=\\\"redText subText\\\" title=\\\"Pat Ferrel - 10\\/Jun\\/14 23:09\\\"\u003eedited\u003c\\/span\u003e                   I think the same thing is happening with number of item interactions: \\n\\n     \\/\\/ Broadcast vector containing the number of interactions with each thing \\n    val bcastNumInteractions = drmBroadcast(drmI.colSums)\\/\\/ sums? \\n\\n This broadcasts a vector of sums. We need a getNumNonZeroElements() for column vectors,  actually a way to get a Vector of nonZero counts per column? We could get them from rows of the transposed matrix before doing the multiply of At % % A or B.t % % A in which case we\\u2019d get non-zero counts from the rows. Either way I don\\u2019t see a way to get a vector of these values without doing a mapBlock on the transposed matrix. Am I missing something? \\n\\n Currently the IndexedDataset is a very thin wrapper but I could add two vectors, which contain number of non-zero elements for rows and columns. In this case I would have it extend CheckpointedDrm perhaps. Since CheckpointedDrm extends DrmLike it could be used in the DSL algebra directly, in which case it would be simple to do the right thing with these vectors as well as the two id dictionaries for transpose and multiply but it\\u2019s a slippery slope. \\n\\n Before I go off in the wrong direction is there an existing way to get a vector of non-zero counts for rows or columns?              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-14027182\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=pferrel\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"pferrel\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Pat Ferrel\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14027986_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'11\\/Jun\\/14 16:38\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-11T16:38:35+0000\'\u003e11\\/Jun\\/14 16:38\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe algo transposes A (the primary) before self-coocurrence. That gives us a point to look at columns when they are rows, which in turn makes distributed ops on the drm simple. So rather than looking at the counts for columns, my earlier proposal was to look at the same data when it is a row. Might this be better since it can easily be a distributed calculation?\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eIn other words since A.t * A is calculated, we can split this into transpose and multiply taking column counts from the rows of A.t then doing the multiply after. In the list of calculations: A.t * A, B.t * A, ... each include a state where the columns turn into rows and so the same approach can be used.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThis introduces what was a bug as a significant optimization. If the data is already boolean, use the colSums then no distributed counting is needed.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eNot sure if the above is all true, so read it as a question\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"pferrel\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_14027986_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=pferrel\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"pferrel\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Pat Ferrel\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14027986_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'11\\/Jun\\/14 16:38\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-11T16:38:35+0000\'\u003e11\\/Jun\\/14 16:38\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    The algo transposes A (the primary) before self-coocurrence. That gives us a point to look at columns when they are rows, which in turn makes distributed ops on the drm simple. So rather than looking at the counts for columns, my earlier proposal was to look at the same data when it is a row. Might this be better since it can easily be a distributed calculation? \\n\\n In other words since A.t * A is calculated, we can split this into transpose and multiply taking column counts from the rows of A.t then doing the multiply after. In the list of calculations: A.t * A, B.t * A, ... each include a state where the columns turn into rows and so the same approach can be used. \\n\\n This introduces what was a bug as a significant optimization. If the data is already boolean, use the colSums then no distributed counting is needed. \\n\\n Not sure if the above is all true, so read it as a question \\n             \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-14028342\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small href=\\\"\\/jira\\/browse\\/MAHOUT-1464?focusedCommentId=14028342&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-14028342\\\"\\n                   title=\\\"Right click and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-link\\\"\u003ePermalink\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n                                            \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details\\\"\u003e        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"tdunning\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_14028342_verbose\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=tdunning\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg Dunning\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14028342_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'11\\/Jun\\/14 20:27\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-11T20:27:36+0000\'\u003e11\\/Jun\\/14 20:27\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eI don\'t understand the question.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eIn fact, the transpose is never computed explicitly.  There is a special operation that does A\' A in a single pass and step.  It is possible to fuse the down-sampling into this multiplication, but not possible to fuse the column counts.  For large sparse A, the value of A\'A is computed using a map-reduce style data flow where each row is examined and all cooccurrence counts are emitted to be grouped by row number later.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eIn order to save memory, it is probably a good idea to discard the original counts as soon as they are reduced to binary form and down-sampled.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eFor computing counts, it is possible to accumulate column sums in a row-wise accumulator at the same time that row sums are accumulated one element at a time.  This avoids a pass over A and probably helps significantly on speed.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"tdunning\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_14028342_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=tdunning\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"tdunning\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Ted Dunning\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14028342_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'11\\/Jun\\/14 20:27\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-11T20:27:36+0000\'\u003e11\\/Jun\\/14 20:27\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    I don\'t understand the question. \\n\\n In fact, the transpose is never computed explicitly.  There is a special operation that does A\' A in a single pass and step.  It is possible to fuse the down-sampling into this multiplication, but not possible to fuse the column counts.  For large sparse A, the value of A\'A is computed using a map-reduce style data flow where each row is examined and all cooccurrence counts are emitted to be grouped by row number later. \\n\\n In order to save memory, it is probably a good idea to discard the original counts as soon as they are reduced to binary form and down-sampled. \\n\\n For computing counts, it is possible to accumulate column sums in a row-wise accumulator at the same time that row sums are accumulated one element at a time.  This avoids a pass over A and probably helps significantly on speed.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n Then used it instead of colSums.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eCooccurrence now passes tests with non-boolean data.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eScary adding to Dmitriy\'s code though so I\'ll invite him to look at it. id=\\\"comment-14028773\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-link\\\"\u003ePermalink\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n                                            \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details\\\"\u003e href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=tdunning\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg
