Dunning\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14028773_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'12\\/Jun\\/14 03:02\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-12T03:02:13+0000\'\u003e12\\/Jun\\/14 03:02\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eShould there be a dedicated colCounts function, or a more general accumulator?\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eBasically, a row-by-row or column-by-column map-reduce aggregator is a common thing to need.  This is different from the aggregateColumns we now have since what we have now doesn\'t requires access to the entire row.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eWhat I would be more interested in would be something like\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cdiv class=\\\"code panel\\\" style=\\\"border-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeContent panelContent\\\"\u003e\\n\u003cpre class=\\\"code-java\\\"\u003e      Vector r = v.aggregateByRows(DoubleDoubleFunction combine, DoubleFunction map)\\n\u003c\\/pre\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThe virtue here is that iteration by rows is an efficient way to handle row-major arrangements, but iteration by column works as well:\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cdiv class=\\\"code panel\\\" style=\\\"border-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeContent panelContent\\\"\u003e\\n\u003cpre class=\\\"code-java\\\"\u003e      \u003cspan class=\\\"code-keyword\\\"\u003efor\u003c\\/span\u003e (MatrixSlice row : m) {\\n           \u003cspan class=\\\"code-keyword\\\"\u003efor\u003c\\/span\u003e (\u003cspan class=\\\"code-object\\\"\u003eint\u003c\\/span\u003e i = 0; i &lt; columns; i++) {\\n                r.setQuick(combine.apply(r.getQuick(i), map.apply(row.getQuick(i))));\\n           }\\n      }\\n\u003c\\/pre\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eor\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cdiv class=\\\"code panel\\\" style=\\\"border-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeContent panelContent\\\"\u003e\\n\u003cpre class=\\\"code-java\\\"\u003e     \u003cspan class=\\\"code-keyword\\\"\u003efor\u003c\\/span\u003e (MatrixSlice col: m.columnIterator()) {\\n         r.setQuick(col.index(), col.aggregate(combine, map));\\n    }\\n\u003c\\/pre\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThese are approximate and we don\'t really have a columnIterator, but you can imagine how some kinds of matrix would have such a thing internally.  You can also see how trivially these would be to parallelize.  Arrangements which have row-wise patches of column-major data would also be easy to handle by combining these patterns.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\\n \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"tdunning\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_14028773_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=tdunning\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"tdunning\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Ted Dunning\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14028773_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'12\\/Jun\\/14 03:02\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-12T03:02:13+0000\'\u003e12\\/Jun\\/14 03:02\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Should there be a dedicated colCounts function, or a more general accumulator? \\n\\n Basically, a row-by-row or column-by-column map-reduce aggregator is a common thing to need.  This is different from the aggregateColumns we now have since what we have now doesn\'t requires access to the entire row. \\n\\n What I would be more interested in would be something like \\n\\n  \\n       Vector r = v.aggregateByRows(DoubleDoubleFunction combine, DoubleFunction map)\\n \\n  \\n\\n The virtue here is that iteration by rows is an efficient way to handle row-major arrangements, but iteration by column works as well: \\n\\n  \\n        for  (MatrixSlice row : m) {\\n            for  ( int  i = 0; i &lt; columns; i++) {\\n                r.setQuick(combine.apply(r.getQuick(i), map.apply(row.getQuick(i))));\\n           }\\n      }\\n \\n  \\n\\n or \\n\\n  \\n       for  (MatrixSlice col: m.columnIterator()) {\\n         r.setQuick(col.index(), col.aggregate(combine, map));\\n    }\\n \\n  \\n\\n These are approximate and we don\'t really have a columnIterator, but you can imagine how some kinds of matrix would have such a thing internally.  You can also see how trivially these would be to parallelize.  Arrangements which have row-wise patches of column-major data would also be easy to handle by combining these patterns. \\n\\n\\n             \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-14028775\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-expanded\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHide\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-links\\\"\u003e\\n                \u003ca href=\\\"\\/jira\\/browse\\/MAHOUT-1464?focusedCommentId=14028775&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-14028775\\\"\\n                   title=\\\"Right click I didn\'t even know it was happening.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e    I think that a non-zero counter is nice, but it would be better to have a more general general aggregator of somethings.  We have two instances already of this pattern and there will be more (sum of the abs values is common).\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e    Why not implement a general aggregator?  THis is different from our current aggregateColumns because that function is not parallelizable.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e    Something like def columnAggregator(combiner, mapper) is what I am aiming for.  Positive counter would be m.columnAggregator(_ + _, _ &gt; 0)\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"githubbot\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_14029315_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=githubbot\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"githubbot\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e ASF GitHub Bot\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14029315_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'12\\/Jun\\/14 16:16\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-12T16:16:20+0000\'\u003e12\\/Jun\\/14 16:16\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Github user tdunning commented on the pull request: \\n\\n      https:\\/\\/github.com\\/apache\\/mahout\\/pull\\/12#issuecomment-45913357  \\n\\n     This discussion isn\'t getting echoed to the mailing list.  I didn\'t even know it was happening. \\n\\n     I think that a non-zero counter is nice, but it would be better to have a more general general aggregator of somethings.  We have two instances already of this pattern and there will be more (sum of the abs values is common). \\n\\n     Why not implement a general aggregator?  THis is different from our current aggregateColumns because that function is not parallelizable. \\n\\n     Something like def columnAggregator(combiner, mapper) is what I am aiming for.  Positive counter would be m.columnAggregator(_ + _, _ &gt; 0) \\n\\n             \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n Ellen Friedman: Practical Machine Learning, Innovations in Recommendation\\\",\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + * available at \u003ca href=\\\"http:\\/\\/www.mapr.com\\/practical-machine-learning\\\" class=\\\"external-link\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow\\\"\u003ehttp:\\/\\/www.mapr.com\\/practical-machine-learning\u003c\\/a\u003e\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + *\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + * see also \\\"Sebastian Schelter, Christoph Boden, Volker Markl:\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + * Scalable Similarity-Based Neighborhood Methods with MapReduce\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + * ACM Conference on Recommender Systems 2012\\\"\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + *\\/\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +object CooccurrenceAnalysis extends Serializable {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  \\/** Compares (Int,Double) pairs by the second value *\\/\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  private val orderByScore = Ordering.fromLessThan\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;(Int, Double)&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n{ case ((_, score1), (_, score2)) =&gt; score1 &gt; score2}\\n\u003cp\u003e    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  def cooccurrences(drmARaw: DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e, randomSeed: Int = 0xdeadbeef, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int = 50,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +                    maxNumInteractions: Int = 500, drmBs: Array[DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e] = Array()): List[DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e] = {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmARaw.context\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Apply selective downsampling, pin resulting matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmA = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmARaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ num users, which equals the maximum number of interactions per item\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val numUsers = drmA.nrow.toInt\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in A\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val bcastInteractionsPerItemA = drmBroadcast(drmA.colCounts)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    &#8212; End diff &#8211;\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e    drmA is already binary here, so we could use colSums\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"githubbot\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_14029445_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=githubbot\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"githubbot\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e ASF GitHub Bot\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14029445_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'12\\/Jun\\/14 17:21\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-12T17:21:14+0000\'\u003e12\\/Jun\\/14 17:21\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Github user sscdotopen commented on a diff in the pull request: \\n\\n      https:\\/\\/github.com\\/apache\\/mahout\\/pull\\/12#discussion_r13713951  \\n\\n     &#8212; Diff: spark\\/src\\/main\\/scala\\/org\\/apache\\/mahout\\/cf\\/CooccurrenceAnalysis.scala &#8212; \\n    @@ -0,0 +1,214 @@ \\n    +\\/* \\n    + * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more \\n    + * contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file distributed with \\n    + * this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership. \\n    + * The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0 \\n    + * (the \\\"License\\\"); you may not use this file except in compliance with \\n    + * the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at \\n    + * \\n    + *      http:\\/\\/www.apache.org\\/licenses\\/LICENSE-2.0  \\n    + * \\n    + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software \\n    + * distributed under the License is distributed on an \\\"AS IS\\\" BASIS, \\n    + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. \\n    + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and \\n    + * limitations under the License. \\n    + *\\/ \\n    + \\n    +package org.apache.mahout.cf \\n    + \\n    +import org.apache.mahout.math._ \\n    +import scalabindings._ \\n    +import RLikeOps._ \\n    +import drm._ \\n    +import RLikeDrmOps._ \\n    +import org.apache.mahout.sparkbindings._ \\n    +import scala.collection.JavaConversions._ \\n    +import org.apache.mahout.math.stats.LogLikelihood \\n    +import collection._ \\n    +import org.apache.mahout.common.RandomUtils \\n    +import org.apache.mahout.math.function. \\n{VectorFunction, Functions}\\n     + \\n    + \\n    +\\/** \\n    + * based on \\\"Ted Dunnning &amp; Ellen Friedman: Practical Machine Learning, Innovations in Recommendation\\\", \\n    + * available at  http:\\/\\/www.mapr.com\\/practical-machine-learning  \\n    + * \\n    + * see also \\\"Sebastian Schelter, Christoph Boden, Volker Markl: \\n    + * Scalable Similarity-Based Neighborhood Methods with MapReduce \\n    + * ACM Conference on Recommender Systems 2012\\\" \\n    + *\\/ \\n    +object CooccurrenceAnalysis extends Serializable { \\n    + \\n    +  \\/** Compares (Int,Double) pairs by the second value *\\/ \\n    +  private val orderByScore = Ordering.fromLessThan &#91;(Int, Double)&#93;   \\n{ case ((_, score1), (_, score2)) =&gt; score1 &gt; score2}\\n     + \\n    +  def cooccurrences(drmARaw: DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; , randomSeed: Int = 0xdeadbeef, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int = 50, \\n    +                    maxNumInteractions: Int = 500, drmBs: Array[DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; ] = Array()): List[DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; ] = { \\n    + \\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmARaw.context \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Apply selective downsampling, pin resulting matrix \\n    +    val drmA = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmARaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions) \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ num users, which equals the maximum number of interactions per item \\n    +    val numUsers = drmA.nrow.toInt \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in A \\n    +    val bcastInteractionsPerItemA = drmBroadcast(drmA.colCounts) \\n    &#8212; End diff &#8211; \\n\\n     drmA is already binary here, so we could use colSums              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-14029446\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block score1 &gt; score2}\\n\u003cp\u003e    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  def cooccurrences(drmARaw: DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e, randomSeed: Int = 0xdeadbeef, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int = 50,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +                    maxNumInteractions: Int = 500, drmBs: Array[DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e] = Array()): List[DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e] = {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmARaw.context\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Apply selective downsampling, pin resulting matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmA = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmARaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ num users, which equals the maximum number of interactions per item\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val numUsers = drmA.nrow.toInt\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in A\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val bcastInteractionsPerItemA = drmBroadcast(drmA.colCounts)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute co-occurrence matrix A\'A\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmAtA = drmA.t %*% drmA\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute loglikelihood scores and sparsify the resulting matrix to get the indicator matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmIndicatorsAtA = computeIndicators(drmAtA, numUsers, maxInterestingItemsPerThing, bcastInteractionsPerItemA,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +      bcastInteractionsPerItemA, crossCooccurrence = false)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    var indicatorMatrices = List(drmIndicatorsAtA)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Now look at cross-co-occurrences\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    for (drmBRaw &lt;- drmBs) {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +      \\/\\/ Down-sample and pin other interaction matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +      val drmB = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmBRaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions).checkpoint()\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +      \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in B\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +      val bcastInteractionsPerThingB = drmBroadcast(drmB.colCounts)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    &#8212; End diff &#8211;\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e    drmB is already binary here, so we could use colSums\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"githubbot\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_14029446_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=githubbot\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"githubbot\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e ASF GitHub Bot\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14029446_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'12\\/Jun\\/14 17:21\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-06-12T17:21:39+0000\'\u003e12\\/Jun\\/14 17:21\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Github user sscdotopen commented on a diff in the pull request: \\n\\n      https:\\/\\/github.com\\/apache\\/mahout\\/pull\\/12#discussion_r13713968  \\n\\n     &#8212; score1 &gt; score2}\\n     + \\n    +  def cooccurrences(drmARaw: DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; , randomSeed: Int = 0xdeadbeef, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int = 50, \\n    + +    \\/\\/ Apply selective downsampling, pin resulting matrix \\n    +    val drmA = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmARaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions) \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ num users, which equals the maximum number of interactions per item \\n    +    val numUsers = drmA.nrow.toInt \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in A \\n    +    val bcastInteractionsPerItemA = drmBroadcast(drmA.colCounts) \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute co-occurrence matrix A\'A \\n    +    val drmAtA = drmA.t %*% drmA \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute loglikelihood scores and sparsify the resulting matrix to get the indicator matrix \\n    +    val drmIndicatorsAtA = computeIndicators(drmAtA, numUsers, maxInterestingItemsPerThing, bcastInteractionsPerItemA, \\n    +      bcastInteractionsPerItemA, crossCooccurrence = false) \\n    + \\n    +    var indicatorMatrices = List(drmIndicatorsAtA) \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Now look at cross-co-occurrences \\n    +    for (drmBRaw &lt;- drmBs) { \\n    +      \\/\\/ Down-sample and pin other interaction matrix \\n    +      val drmB = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmBRaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions).checkpoint() \\n    + \\n    +      \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in B \\n    +      val bcastInteractionsPerThingB = drmBroadcast(drmB.colCounts) \\n    &#8212; End diff &#8211; \\n\\n     drmB is already binary here, so we could use colSums              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n matrix A\'A\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmAtA = drmA.t %*% drmA\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute loglikelihood scores and sparsify the resulting matrix to get the indicator matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmIndicatorsAtA = computeIndicators(drmAtA, numUsers, maxInterestingItemsPerThing, bcastInteractionsPerItemA,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +      bcastInteractionsPerItemA, crossCooccurrence = false)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    var indicatorMatrices = List(drmIndicatorsAtA)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Now look at cross-co-occurrences\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    for (drmBRaw &lt;- drmBs) \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n{\\n    +      \\/\\/ Down-sample and pin other interaction matrix\\n    +      val drmB = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmBRaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions).checkpoint()\\n    +\\n    +      \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in B\\n    +      val bcastInteractionsPerThingB = drmBroadcast(drmB.colCounts)\\n    +\\n    +      \\/\\/ Compute cross-co-occurrence matrix B\'A\\n    +      val drmBtA = drmB.t %*% drmA\\n    +\\n    +      val drmIndicatorsBtA = computeIndicators(drmBtA, numUsers, maxInterestingItemsPerThing,\\n    +        bcastInteractionsPerThingB, bcastInteractionsPerItemA)\\n    +\\n    +      indicatorMatrices = indicatorMatrices :+ drmIndicatorsBtA\\n    +\\n    +      drmB.uncache()\\n    +    }\\n\u003cp\u003e    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Unpin downsampled interaction matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    drmA.uncache()\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Return list of indicator matrices\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    indicatorMatrices\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  }\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  \\/**\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   * Compute loglikelihood ratio\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   * see \u003ca href=\\\"http:\\/\\/tdunning.blogspot.de\\/2008\\/03\\/surprise-and-coincidence.html\\\" class=\\\"external-link\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow\\\"\u003ehttp:\\/\\/tdunning.blogspot.de\\/2008\\/03\\/surprise-and-coincidence.html\u003c\\/a\u003e for details\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   **\\/\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  def loglikelihoodRatio(numInteractionsWithA: Long, numInteractionsWithB: Long,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +                         numInteractionsWithAandB: Long, numInteractions: Long) = \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n{\\n    +\\n    +    val k11 = numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k12 = numInteractionsWithA - numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k21 = numInteractionsWithB - numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k22 = numInteractions - numInteractionsWithA - numInteractionsWithB + numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +\\n    +    LogLikelihood.logLikelihoodRatio(k11, k12, k21, k22)\\n    +  }\\n\u003cp\u003e    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  def computeIndicators(drmBtA: DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e, numUsers: Int, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +                        bcastNumInteractionsB: BCast\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Vector&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e, {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    drmBtA.mapBlock() {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +      case (keys, block) =&gt;\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        val llrBlock = block.like()\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        val numInteractionsB: Vector = bcastNumInteractionsB\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        val numInteractionsA: Vector = keys(index)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          \\/\\/ PriorityQueue to select the top-k items\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          val topItemsPerThing = new mutable.PriorityQueue\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;(Int, Double)&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e()(orderByScore)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          block(index, :\u003cimg class=\\\"emoticon\\\" src=\\\"\\/jira\\/images\\/icons\\/emoticons\\/smile.png\\\" height=\\\"16\\\" width=\\\"16\\\" align=\\\"absmiddle\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" border=\\\"0\\\"\\/\u003e.nonZeroes().foreach { elem =&gt;\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +            val thingA = elem.index\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +            val cooccurrences = elem.get\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +            \\/\\/ exclude co-occurrences of the item with itself\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +            if (crossCooccurrence || thingB != }\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          }\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          \\/\\/ Add top-k interesting items to the output matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  \\/**\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   * Selectively downsample users and things with an anomalous amount of interactions, inspired by\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   * \u003ca href=\\\"https:\\/\\/github.com\\/tdunning\\/in-memory-cooccurrence\\/blob\\/master\\/src\\/main\\/java\\/com\\/tdunning\\/cooc\\/Analyze.java\\\" class=\\\"external-link\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow\\\"\u003ehttps:\\/\\/github.com\\/tdunning\\/in-memory-cooccurrence\\/blob\\/master\\/src\\/main\\/java\\/com\\/tdunning\\/cooc\\/Analyze.java\u003c\\/a\u003e\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   *\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   * additionally binarizes input matrix, as we\'re only interesting in knowing whether interactions happened or not\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   *\\/\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  def sampleDownAndBinarize(drmM: DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e, seed: Int, maxNumInteractions: Int) = {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmM.context\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Pin raw interaction matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmI = See the NOTICE file distributed with \\n    + * this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership. \\n    + * The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0 \\n    + * (the \\\"License\\\"); you may not use this file except in compliance with \\n    + * the License. Ellen Friedman: Practical Machine Learning, Innovations in Recommendation\\\", \\n    + * available at  http:\\/\\/www.mapr.com\\/practical-machine-learning  \\n    + * \\n    + * see also \\\"Sebastian Schelter, Christoph Boden, Volker Markl: \\n    + * Scalable Similarity-Based Neighborhood Methods with MapReduce \\n    + * ACM Conference on Recommender Systems 2012\\\" \\n    + *\\/ \\n    +object CooccurrenceAnalysis extends Serializable { \\n    + \\n    +  \\/** Compares (Int,Double) pairs by the second value *\\/ \\n    +  private val orderByScore = Ordering.fromLessThan &#91;(Int, Double)&#93;   \\n{ case ((_, score1), (_, score2)) =&gt; score1 &gt; score2}\\n     + \\n    +  def cooccurrences(drmARaw: DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; , randomSeed: Int = 0xdeadbeef, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int = 50, \\n    +                    maxNumInteractions: Int = 500, drmBs: Array[DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; ] = Array()): List[DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; ] = { \\n    + \\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmARaw.context \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Apply selective downsampling, pin resulting matrix \\n    +    val drmA = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmARaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions) \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ num users, which equals the maximum number of interactions per item \\n    +    val numUsers = drmA.nrow.toInt \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in A \\n    +    val bcastInteractionsPerItemA = drmBroadcast(drmA.colCounts) \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute co-occurrence matrix A\'A \\n    +    val drmAtA = drmA.t %*% drmA \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute loglikelihood scores and sparsify the resulting matrix to get the indicator matrix \\n    +    val drmIndicatorsAtA = computeIndicators(drmAtA, numUsers, maxInterestingItemsPerThing, bcastInteractionsPerItemA, \\n    +      bcastInteractionsPerItemA, crossCooccurrence = false) \\n    + \\n    +    var indicatorMatrices = List(drmIndicatorsAtA) \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Now look at cross-co-occurrences \\n    +    for (drmBRaw &lt;- drmBs)  \\n{\\n    +      \\/\\/ Down-sample and pin other interaction matrix\\n    +      val drmB = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmBRaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions).checkpoint()\\n    +\\n    +      \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in B\\n    +      val bcastInteractionsPerThingB = drmBroadcast(drmB.colCounts)\\n    +\\n    +      \\/\\/ Compute cross-co-occurrence matrix B\'A\\n    +      val drmBtA = drmB.t %*% drmA\\n    +\\n    +      val drmIndicatorsBtA = computeIndicators(drmBtA, numUsers, maxInterestingItemsPerThing,\\n    +        bcastInteractionsPerThingB, bcastInteractionsPerItemA)\\n    +\\n    +      indicatorMatrices = indicatorMatrices :+ drmIndicatorsBtA\\n    +\\n    +      drmB.uncache()\\n    +    }\\n     + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Unpin downsampled interaction matrix \\n    +    drmA.uncache() \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Return list of indicator matrices \\n    +    indicatorMatrices \\n    +  } \\n    + \\n    +  \\/** \\n    +   * Compute loglikelihood ratio \\n    +   * see  http:\\/\\/tdunning.blogspot.de\\/2008\\/03\\/surprise-and-coincidence.html  for details \\n    +   **\\/ \\n    +  def loglikelihoodRatio(numInteractionsWithA: Long, numInteractionsWithB: Long, \\n    +                         numInteractionsWithAandB: Long, numInteractions: Long) =  \\n{\\n    +\\n    +    val k11 = numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k12 = numInteractionsWithA - numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k21 = numInteractionsWithB - numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k22 = numInteractions - numInteractionsWithA - numInteractionsWithB + numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +\\n    +    LogLikelihood.logLikelihoodRatio(k11, k12, k21, k22)\\n    +  }\\n     + \\n    +  def computeIndicators(drmBtA: DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; , numUsers: Int, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int, \\n    +                        bcastNumInteractionsB: BCast &#91;Vector&#93; , bcastNumInteractionsA: BCast &#91;Vector&#93; , \\n    +                        crossCooccurrence: Boolean = true) = { \\n    +    drmBtA.mapBlock() { \\n    +      case (keys, block) =&gt; \\n    + \\n    +        val llrBlock = block.like() \\n    +        val numInteractionsB: Vector = bcastNumInteractionsB \\n    +        val numInteractionsA: Vector = bcastNumInteractionsA \\n    + \\n    +        for (index &lt;- 0 until keys.size) { \\n    + \\n    +          val thingB = keys(index) \\n    + \\n    +          \\/\\/ PriorityQueue to select the top-k items \\n    +          val topItemsPerThing = new mutable.PriorityQueue &#91;(Int, Double)&#93; ()(orderByScore) \\n    + \\n    +          block(index, : .nonZeroes().foreach { elem =&gt; \\n    +            val thingA = elem.index \\n    +            val cooccurrences = elem.get \\n    + \\n    +            \\/\\/ exclude co-occurrences of the item with itself \\n    +            if (crossCooccurrence || thingB != thingA) { \\n    +              \\/\\/ Compute loglikelihood ratio \\n    +              val llrRatio = loglikelihoodRatio(numInteractionsB(thingB).toLong, numInteractionsA(thingA).toLong, \\n    +                cooccurrences.toLong, numUsers) \\n    +              val candidate = thingA -&gt; llrRatio \\n    + \\n    +              \\/\\/ Enqueue item with score, if belonging to the top-k \\n    +              if (topItemsPerThing.size &lt; maxInterestingItemsPerThing)  \\n{\\n    +                topItemsPerThing.enqueue(candidate)\\n    +              }\\n  else if (orderByScore.lt(candidate, topItemsPerThing.head))  \\n{\\n    +                topItemsPerThing.dequeue()\\n    +                topItemsPerThing.enqueue(candidate)\\n    +              }\\n     +            } \\n    +          } \\n    + \\n    +          \\/\\/ Add top-k interesting items to the output matrix \\n    +          topItemsPerThing.dequeueAll.foreach  \\n{\\n    +            case (otherThing, llrScore) =&gt;\\n    +              llrBlock(index, otherThing) = llrScore\\n    +          }\\n     +        } \\n    + \\n    +        keys -&gt; llrBlock \\n    +    } \\n    +  } \\n    + \\n    +  \\/** \\n    +   * Selectively downsample users and things with an anomalous amount of interactions, inspired by \\n    +   *  https:\\/\\/github.com\\/tdunning\\/in-memory-cooccurrence\\/blob\\/master\\/src\\/main\\/java\\/com\\/tdunning\\/cooc\\/Analyze.java  \\n    +   * \\n    +   * additionally binarizes input matrix, as we\'re only interesting in knowing whether interactions happened or not \\n    +   *\\/ \\n    +  def sampleDownAndBinarize(drmM: DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; , seed: Int, maxNumInteractions: Int) = { \\n    + \\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmM.context \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Pin raw interaction matrix \\n    +    val drmI = drmM.checkpoint() \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Broadcast vector containing the number of interactions with each thing \\n    +    val bcastNumInteractions = drmBroadcast(drmI.colCounts) \\n    + \\n    +    val downSampledDrmI = drmI.mapBlock() { \\n    +      case (keys, block) =&gt; \\n    +        val numInteractions: Vector = bcastNumInteractions \\n    + \\n    +        \\/\\/ Use a hash of the unique first key to seed the RNG, makes this computation repeatable in case of failures \\n    +        val random = RandomUtils.getRandom(MurmurHash.hash(keys(0), seed)) \\n    + \\n    +        val downsampledBlock = block.like() \\n    + \\n    +        \\/\\/ Downsample the interaction vector of each user \\n    +        for (userIndex &lt;- 0 until keys.size) { \\n    + \\n    +          val interactionsOfUser = block(userIndex, :  \\n    + \\n    +          \\/\\/todo: can we trust getNumNonZeroElements or is this the upper limit? May have to actually count them? \\n    &#8212; End diff &#8211; \\n\\n     you can trust getNumNonZeroElements.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-14029464\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-expanded\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHide\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n Recommendation\\\", \\n    + * available at  http:\\/\\/www.mapr.com\\/practical-machine-learning  \\n    + * \\n    + * see also \\\"Sebastian Schelter, Christoph Boden, Volker Markl: \\n    + * + \\n    +  \\/** Compares (Int,Double) pairs by the second value *\\/ \\n    +  private val orderByScore = Ordering.fromLessThan &#91;(Int, Double)&#93;   \\n{ case ((_, score1), (_, score2)) =&gt; score1 &gt; score2}\\n     + \\n    +  def cooccurrences(drmARaw: DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; , randomSeed: Int = 0xdeadbeef, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int = 50, \\n    +                    maxNumInteractions: Int = 500, drmBs: Array[DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; ] = Array()): List[DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; ] = { \\n    + \\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmARaw.context \\n    + \\n the maximum number of interactions per item \\n    +    val numUsers = drmA.nrow.toInt \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in A \\n    +    val bcastInteractionsPerItemA = drmBroadcast(drmA.colCounts) \\n    &#8212; End diff &#8211; \\n\\n     colCounts or whatever we call it is just as efficient, is distributed and tells the reader what is *\\/\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +package org.apache.mahout.cf\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import org.apache.mahout.math._\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import scalabindings._\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import RLikeOps._\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import drm._\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import RLikeDrmOps._\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import org.apache.mahout.sparkbindings._\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import scala.collection.JavaConversions._\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import org.apache.mahout.math.stats.LogLikelihood\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import collection._\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import org.apache.mahout.common.RandomUtils\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +import org.apache.mahout.math.function.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n{VectorFunction, Functions}\\n\u003cp\u003e    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\\/**\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + * based on \\\"Ted Dunnning &amp; Ellen Friedman: Practical Machine Learning, Innovations in Recommendation\\\",\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + * available at \u003ca href=\\\"http:\\/\\/www.mapr.com\\/practical-machine-learning\\\" class=\\\"external-link\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow\\\"\u003ehttp:\\/\\/www.mapr.com\\/practical-machine-learning\u003c\\/a\u003e\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + *\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + * see also \\\"Sebastian Schelter, Christoph Boden, Volker Markl:\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + * Scalable Similarity-Based Neighborhood Methods with MapReduce\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + * ACM Conference on Recommender Systems 2012\\\"\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + *\\/\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +object CooccurrenceAnalysis extends Serializable {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  \\/** Compares (Int,Double) pairs by the second value *\\/\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  private val orderByScore = Ordering.fromLessThan\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;(Int, Double)&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n{ case ((_, score1), (_, score2)) =&gt; score1 &gt; score2}\\n\u003cp\u003e    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  def cooccurrences(drmARaw: DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e, randomSeed: Int = 0xdeadbeef, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int = 50,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +                    maxNumInteractions: Int = 500, drmBs: Array[DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e] = Array()): List[DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e] = {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmARaw.context\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Apply selective downsampling, pin resulting matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmA = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmARaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ num users, which equals the maximum number of interactions per item\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val numUsers = drmA.nrow.toInt\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in A\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val bcastInteractionsPerItemA = drmBroadcast(drmA.colCounts)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute co-occurrence matrix A\'A\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmAtA = drmA.t %*% drmA\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute loglikelihood scores and sparsify the resulting matrix to get the indicator matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmIndicatorsAtA = computeIndicators(drmAtA, numUsers, maxInterestingItemsPerThing, bcastInteractionsPerItemA,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +      bcastInteractionsPerItemA, crossCooccurrence = false)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    var indicatorMatrices = List(drmIndicatorsAtA)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Now look at cross-co-occurrences\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    for (drmBRaw &lt;- drmBs) \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n{\\n    +      \\/\\/ Down-sample and pin other interaction matrix\\n    +      val drmB = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmBRaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions).checkpoint()\\n    +\\n    +      \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in B\\n    +      val bcastInteractionsPerThingB = drmBroadcast(drmB.colCounts)\\n    +\\n    +      \\/\\/ Compute cross-co-occurrence matrix B\'A\\n    +      val drmBtA = drmB.t %*% drmA\\n    +\\n    +      val drmIndicatorsBtA = computeIndicators(drmBtA, numUsers, maxInterestingItemsPerThing,\\n    +        bcastInteractionsPerThingB, bcastInteractionsPerItemA)\\n    +\\n    +      indicatorMatrices = indicatorMatrices :+ drmIndicatorsBtA\\n    +\\n    +      drmB.uncache()\\n    +    }\\n\u003cp\u003e    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Unpin downsampled interaction matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    drmA.uncache()\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Return list of indicator matrices\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    indicatorMatrices\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  }\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  \\/**\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   * Compute loglikelihood ratio\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   * see \u003ca href=\\\"http:\\/\\/tdunning.blogspot.de\\/2008\\/03\\/surprise-and-coincidence.html\\\" class=\\\"external-link\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow\\\"\u003ehttp:\\/\\/tdunning.blogspot.de\\/2008\\/03\\/surprise-and-coincidence.html\u003c\\/a\u003e for details\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   **\\/\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  def loglikelihoodRatio(numInteractionsWithA: Long, numInteractionsWithB: Long,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +                         numInteractionsWithAandB: Long, numInteractions: Long) = \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n{\\n    +\\n    +    val k11 = numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k12 = numInteractionsWithA - numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k21 = numInteractionsWithB - numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k22 = numInteractions - numInteractionsWithA - numInteractionsWithB + numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +\\n    +    LogLikelihood.logLikelihoodRatio(k11, k12, k21, k22)\\n    +  }\\n\u003cp\u003e    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  def computeIndicators(drmBtA: DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e, numUsers: Int, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +                        bcastNumInteractionsB: BCast\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Vector&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e, bcastNumInteractionsA: BCast\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Vector&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +                        crossCooccurrence: Boolean = true) = {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    drmBtA.mapBlock() {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +      case (keys, block) =&gt;\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        val llrBlock = block.like()\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        val numInteractionsB: Vector = bcastNumInteractionsB\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        val numInteractionsA: Vector = bcastNumInteractionsA\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        for (index &lt;- 0 until keys.size) {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          val thingB = keys(index)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          \\/\\/ PriorityQueue to select the top-k items\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          val topItemsPerThing = new mutable.PriorityQueue\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;(Int, Double)&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e()(orderByScore)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          block(index, :\u003cimg class=\\\"emoticon\\\" src=\\\"\\/jira\\/images\\/icons\\/emoticons\\/smile.png\\\" height=\\\"16\\\" width=\\\"16\\\" align=\\\"absmiddle\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" border=\\\"0\\\"\\/\u003e.nonZeroes().foreach { elem =&gt;\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +            val thingA = elem.index\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +            val cooccurrences = elem.get\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +            \\/\\/ exclude co-occurrences of the item with itself\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +            if (crossCooccurrence || thingB != thingA) {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +              \\/\\/ Compute loglikelihood ratio\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +              val llrRatio = loglikelihoodRatio(numInteractionsB(thingB).toLong, numInteractionsA(thingA).toLong,\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +                cooccurrences.toLong, numUsers)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +              val candidate = thingA -&gt; llrRatio\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +              \\/\\/ Enqueue item with score, if belonging to the top-k\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +              if (topItemsPerThing.size &lt; maxInterestingItemsPerThing) \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n{\\n    +                topItemsPerThing.dequeue()\\n    +                topItemsPerThing.enqueue(candidate)\\n    +              }\\n\u003cp\u003e    +            }\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          }\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          \\/\\/ Add top-k interesting items to the output matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    + }\\n\u003cp\u003e    +        }\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        keys -&gt; llrBlock\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    }\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  }\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  \\/**\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   * Selectively downsample users and things with an anomalous amount of interactions, inspired by\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   * \u003ca href=\\\"https:\\/\\/github.com\\/tdunning\\/in-memory-cooccurrence\\/blob\\/master\\/src\\/main\\/java\\/com\\/tdunning\\/cooc\\/Analyze.java\\\" class=\\\"external-link\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow\\\"\u003ehttps:\\/\\/github.com\\/tdunning\\/in-memory-cooccurrence\\/blob\\/master\\/src\\/main\\/java\\/com\\/tdunning\\/cooc\\/Analyze.java\u003c\\/a\u003e\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   *\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   * additionally binarizes input matrix, as we\'re only interesting in knowing whether interactions happened or not\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +   *\\/\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +  def sampleDownAndBinarize(drmM: DrmLike\u003cspan class=\\\"error\\\"\u003e&#91;Int&#93;\u003c\\/span\u003e, seed: Int, maxNumInteractions: Int) = {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmM.context\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Pin raw interaction matrix\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val drmI = drmM.checkpoint()\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    \\/\\/ Broadcast vector containing the number of interactions with each thing\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val bcastNumInteractions = drmBroadcast(drmI.colCounts)\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +    val downSampledDrmI = drmI.mapBlock() {\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +      case (keys, block) =&gt;\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        val numInteractions: Vector = bcastNumInteractions\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        \\/\\/ Use a hash of the unique first key to seed the RNG, makes this computation repeatable in case of failures\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +        val random = RandomUtils.getRandom(MurmurHash.hash(keys(0), seed))\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n +\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n    +          \\/\\/todo: can we trust getNumNonZeroElements or is this the upper limit? Diff: spark\\/src\\/main\\/scala\\/org\\/apache\\/mahout\\/cf\\/CooccurrenceAnalysis.scala &#8212; \\n    @@ -0,0 +1,214 @@ \\n    +\\/* \\n    + * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more \\n    + * contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file distributed with \\n    + * this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership. \\n    + * The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0 \\n    + * (the \\\"License\\\"); you may not use this file except in compliance with \\n    + * the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at \\n    + * \\n    + *      http:\\/\\/www.apache.org\\/licenses\\/LICENSE-2.0  \\n    + * \\n    + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software \\n    + * distributed under the License is distributed on an \\\"AS IS\\\" BASIS, \\n    + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. \\n    + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and \\n    + * limitations under the License. \\n    + *\\/ \\n    + \\n    +package org.apache.mahout.cf \\n    + \\n    +import org.apache.mahout.math._ \\n    +import scalabindings._ \\n    +import RLikeOps._ \\n    +import drm._ \\n    +import RLikeDrmOps._ \\n    +import org.apache.mahout.sparkbindings._ \\n    +import scala.collection.JavaConversions._ \\n    +import org.apache.mahout.math.stats.LogLikelihood \\n    +import collection._ \\n    +import org.apache.mahout.common.RandomUtils \\n    +import org.apache.mahout.math.function. \\n{VectorFunction, Functions}\\n     + \\n    + \\n    +\\/** \\n    + * based on \\\"Ted Dunnning &amp; Ellen Friedman: Practical Machine Learning, Innovations in Recommendation\\\", \\n    + * available at  http:\\/\\/www.mapr.com\\/practical-machine-learning  \\n    + * \\n    + * see also \\\"Sebastian Schelter, Christoph Boden, Volker Markl: \\n    + * Scalable Similarity-Based Neighborhood Methods with MapReduce \\n    + * ACM Conference on Recommender Systems 2012\\\" \\n    + *\\/ \\n    +object CooccurrenceAnalysis extends Serializable { \\n    + \\n    +  \\/** Compares (Int,Double) pairs by the second value *\\/ \\n    +  private val orderByScore = Ordering.fromLessThan &#91;(Int, Double)&#93;   \\n{ case ((_, score1), (_, score2)) =&gt; score1 &gt; score2}\\n     + \\n    +  def cooccurrences(drmARaw: DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; , randomSeed: Int = 0xdeadbeef, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int = 50, \\n    +                    maxNumInteractions: Int = 500, drmBs: Array[DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; ] = Array()): List[DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; ] = { \\n    + \\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmARaw.context \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Apply selective downsampling, pin resulting matrix \\n    +    val drmA = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmARaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions) \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ num users, which equals the maximum number of interactions per item \\n    +    val numUsers = drmA.nrow.toInt \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in A \\n    +    val bcastInteractionsPerItemA = drmBroadcast(drmA.colCounts) \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute co-occurrence matrix A\'A \\n    +    val drmAtA = drmA.t %*% drmA \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Compute loglikelihood scores and sparsify the resulting matrix to get the indicator matrix \\n    +    val drmIndicatorsAtA = computeIndicators(drmAtA, numUsers, maxInterestingItemsPerThing, bcastInteractionsPerItemA, \\n    +      bcastInteractionsPerItemA, crossCooccurrence = false) \\n    + \\n    +    var indicatorMatrices = List(drmIndicatorsAtA) \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Now look at cross-co-occurrences \\n    +    for (drmBRaw &lt;- drmBs)  \\n{\\n    +      \\/\\/ Down-sample and pin other interaction matrix\\n    +      val drmB = sampleDownAndBinarize(drmBRaw, randomSeed, maxNumInteractions).checkpoint()\\n    +\\n    +      \\/\\/ Compute &amp; broadcast the number of interactions per thing in B\\n    +      val bcastInteractionsPerThingB = drmBroadcast(drmB.colCounts)\\n    +\\n    +      \\/\\/ Compute cross-co-occurrence matrix B\'A\\n    +      val drmBtA = drmB.t %*% drmA\\n    +\\n    +      val drmIndicatorsBtA = computeIndicators(drmBtA, numUsers, maxInterestingItemsPerThing,\\n    +        bcastInteractionsPerThingB, bcastInteractionsPerItemA)\\n    +\\n    +      indicatorMatrices = indicatorMatrices :+ drmIndicatorsBtA\\n    +\\n    +      drmB.uncache()\\n    +    }\\n     + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Unpin downsampled interaction matrix \\n    +    drmA.uncache() \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Return list of indicator matrices \\n    +    indicatorMatrices \\n    +  } \\n    + \\n    +  \\/** \\n    +   * Compute loglikelihood ratio \\n    +   * see  http:\\/\\/tdunning.blogspot.de\\/2008\\/03\\/surprise-and-coincidence.html  for details \\n    +   **\\/ \\n    +  def loglikelihoodRatio(numInteractionsWithA: Long, numInteractionsWithB: Long, \\n    +                         numInteractionsWithAandB: Long, numInteractions: Long) =  \\n{\\n    +\\n    +    val k11 = numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k12 = numInteractionsWithA - numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k21 = numInteractionsWithB - numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +    val k22 = numInteractions - numInteractionsWithA - numInteractionsWithB + numInteractionsWithAandB\\n    +\\n    +    LogLikelihood.logLikelihoodRatio(k11, k12, k21, k22)\\n    +  }\\n     + \\n    +  def computeIndicators(drmBtA: DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; , numUsers: Int, maxInterestingItemsPerThing: Int, \\n    +                        bcastNumInteractionsB: BCast &#91;Vector&#93; , bcastNumInteractionsA: BCast &#91;Vector&#93; , \\n    +                        crossCooccurrence: Boolean = true) = { \\n    +    drmBtA.mapBlock() { \\n    +      case (keys, block) =&gt; \\n    + \\n    +        val llrBlock = block.like() \\n    +        val numInteractionsB: Vector = bcastNumInteractionsB \\n    +        val numInteractionsA: Vector = bcastNumInteractionsA \\n    + \\n    +        for (index &lt;- 0 until keys.size) { \\n    + \\n    +          val thingB = keys(index) \\n    + \\n    +          \\/\\/ PriorityQueue to select the top-k items \\n    +          val topItemsPerThing = new mutable.PriorityQueue &#91;(Int, Double)&#93; ()(orderByScore) \\n    + \\n    +          block(index, : .nonZeroes().foreach { elem =&gt; \\n    +            val thingA = elem.index \\n    +            val cooccurrences = elem.get \\n    + \\n    +            \\/\\/ exclude co-occurrences of the item with itself \\n    +            if (crossCooccurrence || thingB != thingA) { \\n    +              \\/\\/ Compute loglikelihood ratio \\n    +              val llrRatio = loglikelihoodRatio(numInteractionsB(thingB).toLong, numInteractionsA(thingA).toLong, \\n    +                cooccurrences.toLong, numUsers) \\n    +              val candidate = thingA -&gt; llrRatio \\n    + \\n    +              \\/\\/ Enqueue item with score, if belonging to the top-k \\n    +              if (topItemsPerThing.size &lt; maxInterestingItemsPerThing)  \\n{\\n    +                topItemsPerThing.enqueue(candidate)\\n    +              }\\n  else if (orderByScore.lt(candidate, topItemsPerThing.head))  \\n{\\n    +                topItemsPerThing.dequeue()\\n    +                topItemsPerThing.enqueue(candidate)\\n    +              }\\n     +            } \\n    +          } \\n    + \\n    +          \\/\\/ Add top-k interesting items to the output matrix \\n    +          topItemsPerThing.dequeueAll.foreach  \\n{\\n    +            case (otherThing, llrScore) =&gt;\\n    +              llrBlock(index, otherThing) = llrScore\\n    +          }\\n     +        } \\n    + \\n    +        keys -&gt; llrBlock \\n    +    } \\n    +  } \\n    + \\n    +  \\/** \\n    +   * Selectively downsample users and things with an anomalous amount of interactions, inspired by \\n    +   *  https:\\/\\/github.com\\/tdunning\\/in-memory-cooccurrence\\/blob\\/master\\/src\\/main\\/java\\/com\\/tdunning\\/cooc\\/Analyze.java  \\n    +   * \\n    +   * additionally binarizes input matrix, as we\'re only interesting in knowing whether interactions happened or not \\n    +   *\\/ \\n    +  def sampleDownAndBinarize(drmM: DrmLike &#91;Int&#93; , seed: Int, maxNumInteractions: Int) = { \\n    + \\n    +    implicit val distributedContext = drmM.context \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Pin raw interaction matrix \\n    +    val drmI = drmM.checkpoint() \\n    + \\n    +    \\/\\/ Broadcast vector containing the number of interactions with each thing \\n    +    val bcastNumInteractions = drmBroadcast(drmI.colCounts) \\n    + \\n    +    val downSampledDrmI = drmI.mapBlock() { \\n    +      case (keys, block) =&gt; \\n    +        val numInteractions: Vector = bcastNumInteractions \\n    + \\n    +        \\/\\/ Use a hash of the unique first key to seed the RNG, makes this computation repeatable in case of failures \\n    +        val random = RandomUtils.getRandom(MurmurHash.hash(keys(0), seed)) \\n    + \\n    +        val downsampledBlock = block.like() \\n    + \\n    +        \\/\\/ Downsample the interaction vector of each user \\n    +        for (userIndex &lt;- 0 until keys.size) { \\n    + \\n    +          val interactionsOfUser = block(userIndex, :  \\n    + \\n    +          \\/\\/todo: can we trust getNumNonZeroElements or is this the upper limit? May have to actually count them? \\n    &#8212; End diff &#8211; \\n\\n     got it, I\'ll remove the comment since we do rely on it in the code              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n It is about finding non-zero elements in a Vector.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-14031166\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-expanded\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHide\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-links\\\"\u003e\\n                \u003ca href=\\\"\\/jira\\/browse\\/MAHOUT-1464?focusedCommentId=14031166&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-14031166\\\"\\n                   title=\\\"Right click and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-link\\\"\u003ePermalink\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n                                            \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details\\\"\u003e        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"githubbot\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_14031166_verbose\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=githubbot\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"githubbot\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e ASF GitHub Bot\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - Here I agree that the 1.0, 0.0 is better I\'m hesitant to change it here when 1, and 0 are used throughout the file and I don\'t want to change it everywhere. There is probably more chance of me messing something up accidentally than actually fixing something if I change the whole file. This made a rather easy to fix but nasty error obvious. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eIf A is the primary self-similairty matrix we want to do A\'A with, and B is the secondary matrix, we want to do A\'B with it since for use in a recommender we want rows of the cooccurrence to be IDed by the columns of A (items in A), right?\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThe code does:\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cdiv class=\\\"code panel\\\" style=\\\"border-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeContent panelContent\\\"\u003e\\n\u003cpre class=\\\"code-java\\\"\u003e      \u003cspan class=\\\"code-comment\\\"\u003e\\/\\/ Compute cross-co-occurrence matrix B\'A\\n\u003c\\/span\u003e      val drmBtA = drmB.t %*% drmA\\n\u003c\\/pre\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eit should do:\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cdiv class=\\\"code panel\\\" style=\\\"border-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeContent panelContent\\\"\u003e\\n\u003cpre class=\\\"code-java\\\"\u003e      \u003cspan class=\\\"code-comment\\\"\u003e\\/\\/ Compute cross-co-occurrence matrix A\'B\\n\u003c\\/span\u003e      val drmAtB = drmA.t %*% drmB\\n\u003c\\/pre\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eTed, can you confirm this? It\'s the way I\'ve got it burned into my brain and applying ID translation with completely different IDs in B seems to confirm it.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"pferrel\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_14058025_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=pferrel\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"pferrel\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Pat Ferrel\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_14058025_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'10\\/Jul\\/14 22:02\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-07-10T22:02:39+0000\'\u003e10\\/Jul\\/14 22:02\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Argh, I finally got to looking at cross-cooccurrence with matrices of different dimensions. This made a rather easy to fix but nasty error obvious.  \\n\\n If A is the primary self-similairty matrix we want to do A\'A with, and B is the secondary matrix, we want to do A\'B with it since for use in a recommender we want rows of the cooccurrence to be IDed by the columns of A (items in A), right? \\n\\n The code does: \\n\\n  \\n        \\/\\/ Compute cross-co-occurrence matrix B\'A\\n       val drmBtA = drmB.t %*% drmA\\n \\n  \\n\\n it should do: \\n\\n  \\n        \\/\\/ Compute cross-co-occurrence matrix A\'B\\n       val drmAtB = drmA.t %*% drmB\\n \\n  \\n\\n Ted, can you confirm this? It\'s the way I\'ve got it burned into my brain and applying ID translation with completely different IDs in B seems to confirm it.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n
